channel.title: Just wondering about .jar
channel.description: lets say i have a .jar file called "Hey.jar". I decompress "Hey.jar" and make changes to folders. What do i need to do to make my "Hey" folder into a "Hey.jar" file once again?

item.title: Just wondering about .jar
item.dc:creator: @nm98c nm98c
item.description:
@nm98c wrote:

ehh ill try the jarmaker. i tried to do the manifest thing once but all i ever come up with is a 1kb .jar file, and the one i am attempting to create should be about 1000kb

thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Just wondering about .jar
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:5, topic:418741”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=521284.msg3787751#msg3787751 date=1319033485]

lets say i have a .jar file called “Hey.jar”. I decompress “Hey.jar” and make changes to folders. What do i need to do to make my “Hey” folder into a “Hey.jar” file once again?

Zip it, change the extension on the .zip file (y)?
[/quote]If he is executing the Jar then he will need to learn how to set the main-class in the manifest. ;)[/quote]

Read full topic
